function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Contagious spread of economic instability","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in economic activity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Localised supply chains are found to be more vulnerable to shocks for most countries.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Domestic shocks account for about half of the variation in real gdp due to shocks, illustrating that domestic shocks may be at least as important as a source of instability as foreign shocks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"For 16 out of 22 countries or regions included in the model, real gdp stability falls when all shocks are considered.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation within interconnected supply chains.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Greater localisation of value chains would add further gdp losses to the economic slowdown caused by the pandemic.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in global real gdp by more than 5% relative to the interconnected regime.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Import and export demand falling in real terms proportionally more than real gdp and domestic production.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on domestic production","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rigid international supply chains","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gdp losses from economic slowdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centralization of manufacturing and industry in certain countries","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-income economies as key hubs for service sector","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to foreign supply shocks for smaller economies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Systemic implications of central countries and industries in the global production network","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased centrality of china in global production networks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of market share in a few countries for computer-related products and phones.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extreme concentration of trade in a few importing/exporting firms.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on foreign value-added and export demand in global value chains.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low diversity of suppliers or buyers in supply chains increasing the probability of disruption and propagation of shocks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concentration of suppliers and buyers leading to fragility in the supply chain and market.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High concentration of suppliers or clients at a very granular product level","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Amplification of volatility due to concentration in gvcs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Anticompetitive behaviors associated with concentration in gvcs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Simplified procedures for essential activities may lead to insufficient health and safety measures, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unnecessary heterogeneity of norms and standards may hinder effective responses to disease outbreaks and decrease resilience in the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Competition and diversification in gvcs may lead to increased movement of people and goods, potentially accelerating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Supply chain disruptions during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of localised economies to economic shocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Warning against reshoring of gvcs","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High reliance on foreign demand and value-added in production leading to exposure to foreign shocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High centrality of ’hubs’ in gvc networks magnifying shock propagation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concentration of suppliers or clients making some firms and supply chains vulnerable to shocks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Propagation of economic shocks across different industries and geographical locations through gvcs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of facemasks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on localized production for security of supply","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on global value chains gvcs for essential supplies and production processes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased vulnerability to global shocks due to international specialisation in gvcs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of shocks through global value chains gvcs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruptions in gvcs due to re-localisation policy","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks and instability associated with international fragmentation of production","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cultural differences in perceiving and understanding recommendations for the built environment","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic constraints impacting sustainable social development and vector-free built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exchange of information in public health forums may lead to the spread of misinformation or unverified strategies for malaria control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordination and standardization among institutions and organizations may lead to fragmented and inconsistent approaches to malaria control.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited accessibility to the knowledge management platform may hinder the dissemination of critical information and best practices for malaria control.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of research and data on improving building health impacts and public awareness campaigns","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic constraints associated with generating public awareness","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of relevant information integration into decision-making processes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
